titleStmt.title: A petition to strategos of Oasis Minor (?)
titleStmt.author: Kastor, son of Harmatis and Demarous

msContents.summary: A petition to the strategos asking that the person against whom the complaint is lodged be obliged to post security till the matter is settled at the forthcoming visit of the Prefect and the Idiologos. The lost of the text at the right hand side leaves us in the dark on the nature and details of the dispute.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is unpublished

condition.ab: Well preserved at the top, left and bottom side. Almost the left half of the papyrus is preserved, the right half being lost.

handDesc.p: The text is written in a crude and irregular hand in which most of the letters set down singly, without ligatures.

origin.origPlace: Small Oasis, Middle Egypt, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Praiylos, strategos of Oasis Minor (?) or Oxyrhynchites (?), Middle Egypt, province of Egypt
Kastor, son of Harmatis and Demarous
Harmatis, father of Kastor, husband of Demarous
Demarous, mother of Kastor, wife of Harmatis
Tachonsis, mother of a person from the village Seryphis

provenance.p: Oxyrhynchos (?), Oxyrhynchos, Oxyrhynchite nome, Middle Egypt, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Mikra Oasis (Oasis Minor. Small Oasis), Middle Egypt, province of Egypt;Seryphis, village of the western toparchy, Oxyrhynchite nome, Middle Egypt, province of Egypt

div.ab: To Praiylos, strategos of Small Oasis (?) [ ] from Kastor, son of Harmatis and Demarous, chief-priest in the same Oasis through NN, son of Tachonsis from the village Seryphis. For --- bad --- behaviour against me, but also --- petition --- was sent by --- at the time of Acylius Capitolinus, epistrategos [and subscribed: Meet?]--- the Idiologos --- until the matter is finished at the presence of the illustrious prefect with the Idiologos. Year 11th of the Emperor Caesar Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Pius Armeniacus Medicus Parthicus maximus, Phamenoth 17th. (2nd hand) Kastor, son of Harmatis and Demarous, ex-priest of Oasis --- (translated by NL)

listBibl.bibl: Lewis N, RechPap 3, 29, 1964 -- SB VIII 9905 -- BL VII, 215; BL VIII, 356; BL IX, 267; There is doubt about the reading of the nome at the end of line 1; see BL IX 267, cf. P.Oxy. LV 3781, 20-23n.). After "praiulo stratego", there is a blank space of 2.8 cm until some traces of ink reappear, but the horizontal fibers of the papyrus are lost at this point, and thus, it is difficult to read either "mikras oaseos" or "oksurugxitou". In line 16 after "archierateusas" the reading "tes oaseos" is also doubtful and certainly the restoration "tes oaseos metr[opoleos" (see BL, loc. cit., cf. Wagner, Les Oasis, p. 254, n. 7) is impossible. I read line 16 with a feeling of uncertainty "tos archierateusas epidedoka os p[rokeitai" (NL; forthcoming)
